what: üì¶ These are the packages we will use‚Ä¶.
title: Phenology Calibration with PhenoMeNals
code: library(phenomenals) library(kableExtra) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(lubridate)

title: Phenology Calibration with PhenoMeNals
text: vignette demonstrates calibrate phenological parameters grapevine variety site using phenologyCalibration() function. ‚Äôll use sample datasets included package: colliOrientali: daily weather data bbchSample: observed BBCH stages phenomenalsParameters: model parameters

title: Phenology Calibration with PhenoMeNals
code: data(colliOrientali) data(bbchSample) parameters <- phenomenalsParameters

title: Phenology Calibration with PhenoMeNals
text: Example weather data Example BBCH data
code: kable(head(colliOrientali), caption = "Example weather data") %>%   kable_styling(font_size = 10) kable(head(bbchSample), caption = "Example BBCH data") %>%   kable_styling(font_size = 10)

title: Phenology Calibration with PhenoMeNals
text: : Use small demo weather BBCH dataset Calibrate parameters Carmenere ColliOrientali Run 100 iterations (feel free increase real applications, higher iterations, longer time relax bit) Takes around
code: calib_result <- phenologyCalibration(   weather_data = colliOrientali,   referenceBBCH = bbchSample,   phenomenalsParameters =phenomenalsParameters,   start_year = 2006,   end_year = 2012,   sites = "ColliOrientali",   varieties = "Carmenere",   iterations = 100,   timestep = "daily" ) #> üå¶Ô∏è  Weather data written for site 'ColliOrientali' ‚ûú ColliOrientali.csv #> üê¢ Initiating phenology calibration... #> ‚åõ Be cool ‚Äî algorithms are thinking really hard right now. #> üç∑ Good wine takes time, and so does this model! #>  #> calibration running on Carmenere, title: Phenology Calibration with PhenoMeNals
text: helps users see: ‚Äôs inside (parameters, phenology) ‚Äôs named list
code: str(calib_result, max.level = 1) #> List of 2 #>  $ parameters:'data.frame':  189 obs. of  6 variables: #>  $ phenology :'data.frame':  2557 obs. of  13 variables:

title: Phenology Calibration with PhenoMeNals
text: Calibrated parameters Carmenere ColliOrientali calibrated parameters within defined bounds. üéØ However, parameter close minimum maximum limit, ‚Äôs good practice slightly expand calibration range re-run process. helps avoid boundary effects ensures optimization isn‚Äôt artificially constrained. üìù Tip: Parameters like bbch65 bbch85 consistently hit edge range may indicate biological assumptions need refining, calibration iterations needed.
code: filtered_params <- calib_result$parameters |>   dplyr::filter(site == "colliorientali", variety == "carmenere")  knitr::kable(filtered_params, caption = "Calibrated parameters for Carmenere at ColliOrientali")

title: Phenology Calibration with PhenoMeNals
text: show time series predicted BBCH stages time.  phenologyCalibration() function successfully fits thermal stress-based parameters reproduce observed BBCH stages. calibrated output can now passed runPhenomenals() trait modeling.
code: ggplot(calib_result$phenology |>           mutate(Date=as.Date(Date,format='%m/%d/%Y'),                 year=year(Date)),aes(x=Date)) +    geom_line(aes(y=BBCHPhase))+   geom_point(aes(y=BBCHRef))+   theme_classic()+   geom_line(aes(y=ChillState),col='blue4') #> Warning: Removed 2533 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

title: Authors and Citation
text: Simone Bregaglio. Author, maintainer. Sofia Bajocco. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bregaglio S, Bajocco S (2025). phenomenals: Phenology memory signals. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://GeoModelLab.github.io/phenomenals.
code: @Manual{,   title = {phenomenals: Phenology memory signals},   author = {Simone Bregaglio and Sofia Bajocco},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://GeoModelLab.github.io/phenomenals}, }

title: Phenology memory signals
text: PhenoMeNals phenology-aware predictive framework grapevine yield quality forecasting, integrating phenology simulation, eco-physiological functions, statistical modeling. framework explicitly accounts two-year reproductive cycle grapevine, combining dormancy-forcing phenology model cumulative ‚Äúmemory signals‚Äù derived environmental cues (temperature, radiation, water status, biotic abiotic stresses). signals aligned along standardized phenological timeline weighted correlation yield- quality-related traits, enabling biologically meaningful predictions interpretation carry-effects. Note: PhenoMeNals released R package C# routines invoked R. currently available Windows, cross-platform compatibility development.

title: Phenology memory signals
text: üçá Predicts grapevine yield quality using phenology-aware environmental signals üß† Integrates phenology simulation, eco-physiological functions, statistical modeling üìà Accurate forecasting across multiple sites, varieties, years üîç Analyzes carry-effects yield quality ‚öôÔ∏è Hybrid architecture: R interface + C# computation ü™ü Windows-(Mac/Linux support coming soon)

title: Phenology memory signals
text: PhenoMeNals available GitHub. need: R (‚â• 4.0) devtools installation installs R interface compiled C# executable backend (Windows ).
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("GeoModelLab/phenomenals")

title: Phenology memory signals
text: can start included sample datasets: Calibrate phenology : Run full pipeline :
code: library(phenomenals)  head(colliOrientali) head(bbchSample) res <- phenologyCalibration(   weather_data = colliOrientali,   referenceBBCH = bbchSample,   phenomenalsParameters = phenomenalsParameters,   sites = "ColliOrientali",   varieties = "Carmenere",   iterations = 50,   start_year = 2004,   end_year = 2015,   timestep = "daily" ) res <- runPhenomenals(   weather_data = colliOrientali,   target_data = targetSample,   phenomenalsParameters = phenomenalsParameters,   sites = "ColliOrientali",   varieties = "Carmenere",   timestep = "daily",   target_traits = c("yield"),   rolling_window = 5,   evaluation_range = list(c(0, 200)),   multicollinearity_threshold = 0.8,   max_phenomenals = 4,   bin_size = 1 )

title: Phenology memory signals
text: Use ?phenologyCalibration ?runPhenomenals access documentation inside R. explore , visit pkgdown website: üìö https://geomodellab.github.io/phenomenals

what: Sample Phenological Observations (BBCH) for Carmenere ‚Äî bbchSample
title: Sample Phenological Observations (BBCH) for Carmenere ‚Äî bbchSample
text: small dataset observed BBCH growth stages grape variety Carmenere collected Colli Orientali site. Used calibration phenology models.

title: Sample Phenological Observations (BBCH) for Carmenere ‚Äî bbchSample
code: data(bbchSample)

title: Sample Phenological Observations (BBCH) for Carmenere ‚Äî bbchSample
text: data frame 6 rows 6 columns: Variety Grape variety name (e.g., "Carmenere") Site Site name (e.g., "ColliOrientali") Latitude Latitude site (decimal degrees) Longitude Longitude site (decimal degrees) Date Observation date (class: Date) BBCH Observed BBCH stage (numeric)

title: Sample Phenological Observations (BBCH) for Carmenere ‚Äî bbchSample
code: data(bbchSample) head(bbchSample) #>     Variety           Site Latitude Longitude       Date BBCH #> 1 Carmenere ColliOrientali       44        11 2007-04-01    8 #> 2 Carmenere ColliOrientali       44        11 2008-04-28    8 #> 3 Carmenere ColliOrientali       44        11 2009-04-19    8 #> 4 Carmenere ColliOrientali       44        11 2010-04-21    8 #> 5 Carmenere ColliOrientali       44        11 2011-04-18    8 #> 6 Carmenere ColliOrientali       44        11 2012-04-26    8

what: Daily Weather Data for Colli Orientali ‚Äî colliOrientali
title: Daily Weather Data for Colli Orientali ‚Äî colliOrientali
text: sample daily weather dataset used demonstrate phenology calibration.

title: Daily Weather Data for Colli Orientali ‚Äî colliOrientali
code: data(colliOrientali)

title: Daily Weather Data for Colli Orientali ‚Äî colliOrientali
text: data frame 11 columns: Site Site name (fixed: "ColliOrientali") Date Date (Date object) Tmax Maximum temperature (¬∞C) Tmin Minimum temperature (¬∞C) Precipitation Precipitation (mm) WindSpeed Wind speed (m/s) RelativeHumidityMax Max relative humidity (%) RelativeHumidityMin Min relative humidity (%) Radiation Solar radiation (MJ/m¬≤) Latitude Latitude (decimal degrees) Longitude Longitude (decimal degrees)

title: List Available Calibrated Varieties ‚Äî listAvailableVarieties
text: Lists CSV files containing calibrated parameters included package additional user-calibrated files given directory.

title: List Available Calibrated Varieties ‚Äî listAvailableVarieties
code: listAvailableVarieties(user_dir = NULL)

title: List Available Calibrated Varieties ‚Äî listAvailableVarieties
text: user_dir Optional. Path folder containing user-calibrated parameter files.

title: List Available Calibrated Varieties ‚Äî listAvailableVarieties
text: character vector available calibrated variety filenames.

title: Run phenologyCalibration ‚Äî phenologyCalibration
text: function runs Phenomenals phenology model passing weather data phenological observations (BBCH) directly R underlying C# executable. Users need manage configuration files binaries manually. paths execution logic handled internally, core calibration settings exposed.

title: Run phenologyCalibration ‚Äî phenologyCalibration
code: phenologyCalibration(   weather_data,   referenceBBCH,   phenomenalsParameters,   start_year = 2000,   end_year = 2025,   sites = "all",   varieties = "all",   iterations = 100,   timestep = "daily" )

title: Run phenologyCalibration ‚Äî phenologyCalibration
text: weather_data data frame containing hourly weather data. Must include following columns: Latitude, Longitude, DateTime (POSIXct character), Temperature (¬∞C), Precipitation (mm), RelativeHumidity (%), Radiation (MJ/m¬≤), WindSpeed (m/s). referenceBBCH data frame containing BBCH phenological observations. Must include: Variety, Site, Latitude, Longitude, Date, BBCH phenomenalsParameters nested list model parameters (usually loaded phenomenals::parameters_nested), structured list[species][[class]][[parameter]], parameter list : min: Minimum calibration value (numeric) max: Maximum calibration value (numeric) value: Default value used simulation (numeric) calibration: Logical; TRUE parameter subject calibration can start phenomenals::phenomenalsParameters modify needed. list automatically converted CSV format required C# executable. start_year first year simulation calibration period (default 2000). end_year last year simulation calibration period (default 2025). sites character vector site names (e.g., "ColliOrientali"). Defaults "site1" provided. varieties character vector variety names include calibration (default: ""). iterations Number iterations simplex (default: 100). timestep Time step input weather data; must "hourly" (default) "daily".

title: Run phenologyCalibration ‚Äî phenologyCalibration
text: named list data frames containing model outputs, loaded output CSV files generated Phenomenals executable. names list entries correspond output file names (without .csv).

title: Run phenologyCalibration ‚Äî phenologyCalibration
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- phenologyCalibration(   weather_data = weather_df,   referenceBBCH = bbch_df,   phenomenalsParameters,   start_year = 2010,   end_year = 2020,   sites = "ColliOrientali",   varieties = "Merlot",   simplexes = 2,   iterations = 300,   timestep = 'daily' ) head(result$phenology) } # }

title: Default phenology parameters ‚Äî phenomenalsParameters
text: nested list default parameters used Phenomenals model.

title: Default phenology parameters ‚Äî phenomenalsParameters
code: phenomenalsParameters

title: Default phenology parameters ‚Äî phenomenalsParameters
text: named list species ‚Üí class ‚Üí parameter ‚Üí list(min, max, value, calibration).

title: Default phenology parameters ‚Äî phenomenalsParameters
code: parameters_nested[["grapevine"]][["phenomenalsParameters"]][["TminPhenology"]] #> Error: object 'parameters_nested' not found

title: Run phenologyCalibration ‚Äî runPhenomenals
text: function runs Phenomenals method passing weather data phenological observations (BBCH) directly R underlying C# executable. Users need manage configuration files binaries manually. paths execution logic handled internally, core calibration settings exposed.

title: Run phenologyCalibration ‚Äî runPhenomenals
code: runPhenomenals(   weather_data,   target_data,   phenomenalsParameters,   start_year = 2000,   end_year = 2025,   sites = "all",   varieties = "all",   timestep = "daily",   target_traits = c("yield"),   rolling_window = 5,   evaluation_range = list(c(0, 200)),   multicollinearity_threshold = 0.8,   max_phenomenals = 4,   bin_size = 1 )

title: Run phenologyCalibration ‚Äî runPhenomenals
text: weather_data data frame containing hourly weather data. Must include following columns: Latitude, Longitude, DateTime (POSIXct character), Temperature (¬∞C), Precipitation (mm), RelativeHumidity (%), Radiation (MJ/m¬≤), WindSpeed (m/s). target_data data frame containing target data (e.g., yield, brix, berry number, malic acid). dataframe must include: Variety, Site, Latitude, Longitude, Date, BBCH. phenomenalsParameters nested list model parameters (usually loaded phenomenals::parameters_nested), structured list[species][[class]][[parameter]], parameter list : min: Minimum calibration value (numeric) max: Maximum calibration value (numeric) value: Default value used simulation (numeric) calibration: Logical; TRUE parameter subject calibration can start phenomenals::phenomenalsParameters modify needed. list automatically converted CSV format required C# executable. start_year first year simulation calibration period (numeric, default 2000). end_year last year simulation calibration period (numeric, default 2025). sites character vector site names (e.g., "ColliOrientali"). varieties character vector variety names include calibration (default: ""). timestep Time step input weather data; must "daily" (default) "hourly". target_traits target traits applying phenomenals (default "yield"). rolling_window window pane size phenomenals smoothing (default 5 days). evaluation_range list numeric vectors specifying percentage range plant cycle compute phenomenals (0‚Äì200; 0‚Äì100 = dormancy, 101‚Äì200 = growing season). (default list(c(0,200))) multicollinearity_threshold threshold consider phenomenals multicorrelations unit cycle percentage (default 0.8). max_phenomenals maximum number phenomenals retain (default 4). bin_size range cycle percentage aggregate phenomenals (default 1).

title: Run phenologyCalibration ‚Äî runPhenomenals
text: named list data frames containing model outputs, including predictions, diagnostics, coefficients, processed phenological signals.

title: Run phenologyCalibration ‚Äî runPhenomenals
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ result <- phenologyCalibration(   weather_data = weather_df,   target_data = bbch_df,   phenomenalsParameters,   start_year = 2010,   end_year = 2020,   sites = "ColliOrientali",   varieties = "Merlot",   timestep = 'daily' ) head(result$phenomenals$processed) } # }

what: Sample Yield Data for Carmenere (Colli Orientali) ‚Äî targetSample
title: Sample Yield Data for Carmenere (Colli Orientali) ‚Äî targetSample
text: dataset contains sample grape yield observations variety Carmenere collected Colli Orientali site. used test trait modeling capabilities phenomenals package.

title: Sample Yield Data for Carmenere (Colli Orientali) ‚Äî targetSample
code: data(targetSample)

title: Sample Yield Data for Carmenere (Colli Orientali) ‚Äî targetSample
text: data frame 6 rows 7 columns: Site Site name (e.g., "ColliOrientali") latitude Site latitude (decimal degrees) longitude Site longitude (decimal degrees) Variety Grape variety (e.g., "Carmenere") Year Year observation Variable Trait name (: "yield") Value Observed value trait (numeric) Unit Unit measurement (e.g., "kg plant-1")

title: Sample Yield Data for Carmenere (Colli Orientali) ‚Äî targetSample
code: data(targetSample) head(targetSample) #>             Site latitude longitude   Variety Year Variable Value       Unit #> 1 ColliOrientali       44        11 Carmenere 2006    yield  2.37 kg plant-1 #> 2 ColliOrientali       44        11 Carmenere 2007    yield  2.75 kg plant-1 #> 3 ColliOrientali       44        11 Carmenere 2008    yield  1.99 kg plant-1 #> 4 ColliOrientali       44        11 Carmenere 2009    yield  2.16 kg plant-1 #> 5 ColliOrientali       44        11 Carmenere 2010    yield  1.64 kg plant-1 #> 6 ColliOrientali       44        11 Carmenere 2011    yield  2.43 kg plant-1
